intro: Zanonia indica subsp. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental sandmat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptic with a rough texture. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils.
